segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely unaware of the water overflowing from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is flooding, and she’s just standing there, polishing a plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how oblivious she is to the mess spreading across the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are sneaking cookies, and she’s missing it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is about to fall, and she’s just humming along, lost in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever look up and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone should tell her before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets if it keeps flowing like that.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t watch this anymore; it’s like a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
